title: Which one is correct, 'Your animations are getting really better' or 'Your animation have been becoming really better'? - Quora

response.answer_text: The word “really” is unnecessary. “Your animations are getting better” is someone pointing out that another person is progressing in skill, but the second sentence is pretty garbled. “Your animations have been getting really good,” or “Your animations have really been getting better,” would work for the second version, where the speaker is pointing out that the object, the animations, have been improving in quality, while the first sentence is talking more about the skill of the person making them. Usually, the word “really” is just there to emphasize an opinion, like, “that thunder was really loud,” to refer to it being louder than normal.
Neither. You can’t get “really better”. You can get “much better” or just “better”. “Your animations are getting much better,” works.
